overview_of_class: This course is an introduction to the study of personality. The course examines theoretical explanations for understanding personality development and explores each theory. The course also investigates how personality is assessed. The focus is on approaches that psychology has developed for understanding personality and on applications for organizational processes. Carries social science credit.
name: Psychology of Personality
title: SCS PSYCH 215-CN-14 Psychology of Personality

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is an introduction to the study of personality. The course examines theoretical explanations for understanding personality development and explores each theory. The course also investigates how personality is assessed. The focus is on approaches that psychology has developed for understanding personality and on applications for organizational processes. Carries social science credit.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The student will be familiar with major theoretical frameworks in personality psychology, modern personality research across a variety of topics, and the intersection between personality psychology and other major areas of psychological research.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be one in-class examination (multiple choice and essay questions), a couple of reading assessments and an optional final project or exam.
